title: Great results when used properly
comment: This is not a crock if you use it as intended and have appropriate expectations. This should not be used as a moisturizer alone as it is just WATER! Water alone left to dry on the skin will simply evaporate and take some of the water in your skin WITH IT (transepidermal water loss), thus potentially being more drying. However, the minerals in thermal water are thought to be beneficial for skin, such as by reducing inflammation, protecting against sun damage, moisturizing, etc (keeping in mind there are only a handful of flawed studies researching this).  The proper way to use thermal water spray is to follow-up immediately with an occlusive moisturizer. It will lock the beneficial thermal water into your skin thus plumping your skin and increasing hydration (temporarily, of course). In my personal experience, I have found that prepping my skin with Avene thermal water before moisturizing has increased the moisture levels in my skin on a day-to-day basis. I use either Cerave PM or First Aid Beauty Ultra Repair Face Moisturizer (followed with sunscreen).
